Consider equations of the form $x^2 + bx + c = 0$. How many such equations have real roots and have coefficients $b$ and $c$ selected from the set of integers $\{1,2,3, 4, 5,6\}$?\\
\\
$\textbf{(A)}\ 20 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 19 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 18 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 17 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 16$
